intro: Byttneria lateralis, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the rainy season. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that split open to release small, hairy seeds. Byttneria lateralis is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks.
